H0.text: Electric cars help lower the effect of global warming caused by burning fossil fuels, which scientists believe is changing the chemical makeup of Earth's atmosphere.

H1.text: Digital cameras would help lower the effect of global warming caused by the burning of fossil fuels, which scientists believe is changing the chemical makeup of Earth's atmosphere.

H2.text: High‑speed Internet is the invention whose use would help lower the effect of burning fossil fuels that contributes to global warming, which scientists believe is changing the chemical makeup of Earth's atmosphere.

H3.text: Battery-powered radio is the invention that would help lower the effect of global warming caused by the burning of fossil fuels, which scientists believe is changing the chemical makeup of Earth's atmosphere.

A4.text: For electricity from the grid, the life‑cycle emissions vary depending on the proportion of coal‑fired power, but are always less than ICE cars.

A5.text: Some activists and journalists have raised concerns over the perceived lack of impact of electric cars in solving the climate change crisis compared to other, less popularized methods.

A6.text: the manufacturing of an EV emitted on average around 50% more CO2 than an equivalent internal combustion engine vehicle, but this difference is more than offset by the much higher emissions from the oil used in driving an internal combustion engine Vehicle over its lifetime compared to those from generating the electricity used for driving the EV.

A7.text: In 2023, Greenpeace issued a video criticizing the view that EVs are 'silver bullet for climate', arguing that the construction phase has a high environmental impact.

A8.text: Cleanly generated electricity can replace fossil fuels for powering transportation, heating buildings, and running industrial processes.
